function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Improper disposal of infectious hospital wastes and wastewater could cause serious risks to public health and the environment.","Impact":"Spread of contagious diseases, including coronaviruses, resulting in public health crises and global emergencies.","Mitigation":"Proper management and disposal of infectious hospital wastes, implementation of strict guidelines and regulations for waste handling, and training of healthcare staff on safe waste management practices.","Technologies":"Advanced waste treatment technologies, such as autoclaves and incinerators, for sterilizing infectious hospital wastes.","People":"General public, healthcare workers, environmental workers","Owner":"Government health departments, hospital administrators, environmental protection agencies"},{"Description":"Transmission routes of SARS-CoV-2 include droplet, contact, and possibly airborne transmission in specific circumstances and settings.","Impact":"Increased risk of virus spread within communities and among close contacts, leading to widespread outbreaks and high infection rates.","Mitigation":"Implementing strict infection control measures, use of personal protective equipment, ventilation improvements in healthcare facilities, and public health education on hygiene and prevention.","Technologies":"Negative pressure isolation rooms, HEPA filters, UV-C air disinfection systems, and contact tracing technologies.","People":"General public, healthcare workers, close contacts of infected individuals","Owner":"Healthcare institutions, public health agencies, government health departments"}]}
